com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue

Interface YCPBeforeCreateExceptionUE


  • public interface YCPBeforeCreateExceptionUE
    User exit that serves as a mechanism for providing more information to createException API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document beforeCreateException(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YCPBeforeCreateExceptionUE user exit is called by the createException API before executing any application logic.

    • Method Detail

      • beforeCreateException

        org.w3c.dom.Document beforeCreateException(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YCPBeforeCreateExceptionUE user exit is called by the createException API before executing any application logic. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to manipulate data obtained from content providers (for example, different applications for order entry, or different web sites having different forms for placing orders) and provide a standard input XML as required by the createException API.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the createException API.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. Any XML document that contains a sufficient amount of data to create an Exception as required by the createException API. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        A valid createException XML. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
